{{cpp/title|exp{{small|(std::valarray)}}}}
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=valarray|1=
template&lt; class T &gt;
valarray&lt;T&gt; exp( const valarray&lt;T&gt;&amp; va );
}}

For each element in {{c|va}} computes ''e'' raised to the power equal to the value of the element.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|va|value array to apply the operation to}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
Value array containing ''e'' raised by the values in {{c|va}}.

===Notes===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes unq|exp}}

{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes ret|exp}}

===Possible implementation===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/impl|exp}}

===Example===
{{example
|This example demonstrates the [[enwiki:Euler's_identity|Euler's identity {{math|e{{su|p=i&amp;pi;}} {{=}} -1}}]] and the related exponents.
|code=
#include &lt;complex&gt;
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;numbers&gt;
#include &lt;valarray&gt;

int main()
{
    const double pi = std::numbers::pi;
    std::valarray&lt;std::complex&lt;double&gt;&gt; v =
    {
        {0, 0}, {0, pi / 2}, {0, pi}, {0, 3 * pi / 2}, {0, 2 * pi}
    };
    std::valarray&lt;std::complex&lt;double&gt;&gt; v2 = std::exp(v);
    for (std::cout &lt;&lt; std::showpos &lt;&lt; std::fixed; auto n : v2)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; n &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
(+1.000000,+0.000000)
(+0.000000,+1.000000)
(-1.000000,+0.000000)
(-0.000000,-1.000000)
(+1.000000,-0.000000)
}}
